record.creatorPhotographer: Payne, Elwood; Paralta Studios, Austin, Texas
record.description: This one-third horsepower electric motor operates the perfectly balanced 75-ton telescope. An outstanding feature of the observatory is its declination-deviation control, which automatically compensates for the earth's rotation, allows for the bending of light rays striking the earth's atmosphere, and keeps the huge instrument constantly focused on stars in their flight through space.
record.publisher: University of Chicago Library, Special Collections Research Center
record.noteGeneral: Photographer's stamp/Stamp: credit line. Additional stamp: [Please return to] Public Relations Committee University of Texas Austin, Texas.
record.noteCopyright: Please credit this photo to Elwood M. Payne-Austin, Texas. Additional copies may be obtained from Paralta Studios of Austin, Texas
